bug.author: litemotif
bug.summary: Strange Matcher behavior with * quantifier and two rules
bug.description:
I'm not sure why these two rules are resulting in a match on the given text. Is this a bug or am I doing something wrong? <denchmark-code>nlp = spacy.load('en') doc = nlp("I took out the trash.") matcher = Matcher(nlp.vocab) matcher.add("rule1", None, [ {'TAG': 'VBD'}, {'LOWER': 'the'}, {'POS': 'NOUN'} ]) matcher.add("rule2", None, [ {'TAG': 'VBD'}, {'IS_ALPHA': True, 'OP': '*'}, {'LOWER': 'any'}, {'LOWER': 'words'} ]) matches = matcher(doc) for (match_id, start, end) in matches: span = doc[start:end]
label = doc.vocab.strings[match_id]
print(label) print(str(span)) </denchmark-code>
The result is a match on rule 1: <denchmark-code>rule1 took out the trash </denchmark-code>
But rule 1 shouldn't allow the word "out." Removing either rule results in no matches. <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: macOS 10.13.3 Python Version Used: 3.6.4 spaCy Version Used: 2.0.8
